value.latex:
Soit $\alpha > 0$.
On pose $u_n = \sum_{k=1}^{n-1} \frac 1{k^\alpha(n-k)^\alpha}$.
\'Etudier la convergence de $\sum u_n$.
value.html: Soit \(\alpha > 0\). On pose \(u_n = \sum_{k=1}^{n-1} \frac 1{k^\alpha(n-k)^\alpha}\). Étudier la convergence de \(\sum u_n\).

value.latex:
$\alpha > 1  \Rightarrow  \sum u_n$ cv et vaut $\zeta(\alpha)^2$.\par
         $\alpha < 1  \Rightarrow  \sum_{n=1}^{2N} u_n \ge
                         \sum_{k=1}^N \frac 1{k^\alpha}
                      \Rightarrow  \sum u_n$ dv.
value.html:
\(\alpha > 1 \Rightarrow \sum u_n\) cv et vaut \(\zeta(\alpha)^2\).

\(\alpha < 1 \Rightarrow \sum_{n=1}^{2N} u_n \ge \sum_{k=1}^N \frac 1{k^\alpha} \Rightarrow \sum u_n\) dv.
